013package org.apache.juneau.internal;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.StringUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.ThrowableUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConverterUtils.*;
019import static java.util.Collections.*;
020
021import java.lang.reflect.*;
022import java.util.*;
023
024import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.parser.*;
026
027/**
028 * Builder for sets.
029 *
030 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
031 * </ul>
032 *
033 * @param <E> Element type.
034 */
035public final class SetBuilder<E> {
036
037   private Set<E> set;
038   private boolean unmodifiable, sparse;
039   private Comparator<E> comparator;
040
041   private Class<E> elementType;
042   private Type[] elementTypeArgs;
043
044   /**
045    * Constructor.
046    *
047    * @param elementType The element type.
048    * @param elementTypeArgs The element type generic arguments if there are any.
049    */
050   public SetBuilder(Class<E> elementType, Type...elementTypeArgs) {
051      this.elementType = elementType;
052      this.elementTypeArgs = elementTypeArgs;
053   }
054
055   /**
056    * Constructor.
057    *
058    * @param addTo The set to add to.
059    */
060   public SetBuilder(Set<E> addTo) {
061      this.set = addTo;
062   }
063
064   /**
065    * Builds the set.
066    *
067    * @return A set conforming to the settings on this builder.
068    */
069   public Set<E> build() {
070      if (sparse) {
071         if (set != null && set.isEmpty())
072            set = null;
073      } else {
074         if (set == null)
075            set = new LinkedHashSet<>(0);
076      }
077      if (set != null) {
078         if (comparator != null) {
079            Set<E> s = new TreeSet<>(comparator);
080            s.addAll(set);
081            set = s;
082         }
083         if (unmodifiable)
084            set = unmodifiableSet(set);
085      }
086      return set;
087   }
088
089   /**
090    * When specified, the {@link #build()} method will return <jk>null</jk> if the set is empty.
091    *
092    * <p>
093    * Otherwise {@link #build()} will never return <jk>null</jk>.
094    *
095    * @return This object.
096    */
097   public SetBuilder<E> sparse() {
098      this.sparse = true;
099      return this;
100   }
101
102   /**
103    * When specified, {@link #build()} will return an unmodifiable set.
104    *
105    * @return This object.
106    */
107   public SetBuilder<E> unmodifiable() {
108      this.unmodifiable = true;
109      return this;
110   }
111
112   /**
113    * Forces the existing set to be copied instead of appended to.
114    *
115    * @return This object.
116    */
117   public SetBuilder<E> copy() {
118      if (set != null)
119         set = new LinkedHashSet<>(set);
120      return this;
121   }
122
123   /**
124    * Converts the set into a {@link SortedSet}.
125    *
126    * @return This object.
127    */
128   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
129   public SetBuilder<E> sorted() {
130      return sorted((Comparator<E>)Comparator.naturalOrder());
131   }
132
133   /**
134    * Converts the set into a {@link SortedSet} using the specified comparator.
135    *
136    * @param comparator The comparator to use for sorting.
137    * @return This object.
138    */
139   public SetBuilder<E> sorted(Comparator<E> comparator) {
140      this.comparator = comparator;
141      return this;
142   }
143
144   /**
145    * Appends the contents of the specified collection into this set.
146    *
147    * <p>
148    * This is a no-op if the value is <jk>null</jk>.
149    *
150    * @param value The collection to add to this set.
151    * @return This object.
152    */
153   public SetBuilder<E> addAll(Collection<E> value) {
154      if (value != null) {
155         if (set == null)
156            set = new LinkedHashSet<>(value);
157         else
158            set.addAll(value);
159      }
160      return this;
161   }
162
163   /**
164    * Adds a single value to this set.
165    *
166    * @param value The value to add to this set.
167    * @return This object.
168    */
169   public SetBuilder<E> add(E value) {
170      if (set == null)
171         set = new LinkedHashSet<>();
172      set.add(value);
173      return this;
174   }
175
176   /**
177    * Adds multiple values to this set.
178    *
179    * @param values The values to add to this set.
180    * @return This object.
181    */
182   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
183   public SetBuilder<E> add(E...values) {
184      for (E v : values)
185         add(v);
186      return this;
187   }
188
189   /**
190    * Adds entries to this set via JSON array strings.
191    *
192    * @param values The JSON array strings to parse and add to this set.
193    * @return This object.
194    */
195   public SetBuilder<E> addJson(String...values) {
196      return addAny((Object[])values);
197   }
198
199   /**
200    * Adds arbitrary values to this set.
201    *
202    * <p>
203    * Objects can be any of the following:
204    * <ul>
205    *    <li>The same type or convertible to the element type of this set.
206    *    <li>Collections or arrays of anything on this set.
207    *    <li>JSON array strings parsed and convertible to the element type of this set.
208    * </ul>
209    *
210    * @param values The values to add.
211    * @return This object.
212    */
213   public SetBuilder<E> addAny(Object...values) {
214      if (elementType == null)
215         throw new IllegalStateException("Unknown element type. Cannot use this method.");
216      try {
217         if (values != null) {
218            for (Object o : values) {
219               if (o != null) {
220                  if (o instanceof Collection) {
221                     ((Collection<?>)o).forEach(x -> addAny(x));
222                  } else if (isArray(o)) {
223                     for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(o); i++)
224                        addAny(Array.get(o, i));
225                  } else if (isJsonArray(o, false)) {
226                     new JsonList(o.toString()).forEach(x -> addAny(x));
227                  } else if (elementType.isInstance(o)) {
228                     add(elementType.cast(o));
229                  } else {
230                     add(toType(o, elementType, elementTypeArgs));
231                  }
232               }
233            }
234         }
235      } catch (ParseException e) {
236         throw asRuntimeException(e);
237      }
238      return this;
239   }
240
241   /**
242    * Adds a value to this set if the specified flag is true.
243    *
244    * @param flag The flag.
245    * @param value The value.
246    * @return This object.
247    */
248   public SetBuilder<E> addIf(boolean flag, E value) {
249      if (flag)
250         add(value);
251      return this;
252   }
253}
